page.title: 01The Windrush West of Burford
page.content: The southern boundary is the valley of the River Windrush. Water meadows, flooded in winter, are used for the grazing of cattle. Great Barrington in the west and Taynton in the east stand above the valley bottom; north of them, where the land rolls gently upwards, grain is grown. At the northern plateau, long vistras appear.Great Barrington and Taynton were once estate villages devoted to farming: Great Barrington remains so with blacksmith's forge, an 18th century Palladian mansion and park and houses set on due long street on the ridge. In Taynton, cottage sit haphazandly around and of one winding road, occupied mainly by retired people. One small farm remain and only occasional blocks and taken from Taynton quarry, famous for its stone (used in St Paul's and many Oxford
